data.text:
Russia is one of the most popular destinations for low-cost MBBS programs in the world. More than 65000 youngsters from all over the world are currently studying medicine in Russian universities. It is also popular among Indian students for the MBBS degree, which is the reason over 2000 students have chosen various universities in Russia to pursue their dream of becoming a doctor. The primary reason for this is the elevated level of education offered by Russia’s top medical schools.

The Russian government has largely funded medical education and tuition fees for Indian students, which has contributed to foreign students enrolling in Russian universities to continue pursuing an MBBS degree. Several Russian institutions are ranked among the top 100 medical universities in the world.

Here is a list of the top medical universities in Russia that provide affordable education while also benefiting from excellent infrastructure and highly qualified faculty.

1. KURSK STATE MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

Kursk State Medical University, established in 1935, is located in Kursk, Russia. It is a well-known educational institution that provides comprehensive medical education to MBBS students. This university is one of the world’s oldest medical universities, offering programs in Medicine, Dentistry, and Pharmacy in English. It has the greatest number of international students from various countries, particularly India. Thousands of international students have graduated from the University and gone on to have successful careers.

2. BASHKIR STATE MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

Bashkir State Medical University, established in 1932, is a leading medical institution in the Russian Federation and the Sovereign State of Bashkortostan’s medical and pharmaceutical research center. There are over 8000 medical students at the University, with over 850 foreign students from 40 countries, 1000 clinical residencies and Ph.D. degrees, and 7000 postgraduate professional pieces of training. The WHO has recognized the university, as has India’s NMC. Students at Bashkir Medical University come from over 50 different countries in Europe, Asia, and Latin America.

3. KAZAN FEDERAL MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

Kazan Federal Medical University is undoubtedly an exemplary university that provides exceptional education, with over 200 years of medical training expertise. Over 700 students from 57 countries study there, with half of the people studying in English. Six hostels are conveniently located near the university. Because the hostels are police-guarded, they are extremely safe. It is listed in the World Directory of Medical Schools by the WHO and is recognized by medical councils such as the ECFMG (USA), AMZ, and the MCI. Kazan Federal Medical University’s FMGE passing rate is 33.13%.

4. CRIMEAN FEDERAL MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

With experienced faculty and a well-established infrastructure, Crimean State Medical University offers an excellent education. It is one of the most prestigious medical schools in Russia. Currently, approximately 2500 international students from 60 countries are enrolled. All educational programs are regulated and authorised by Russia’s Ministries of Education and Science, as well as the Ministry of Health. The University’s degrees and certificates have been authorized by the Russian Ministry of Health and the Russian Ministry of International Affairs.

5. SAINT PETERSBURG STATE MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

In 1897, Saint Petersburg State Medical University was founded. This was the first institution in Russia and Europe to allow women to pursue higher education in medicine. Academy has grown to become one of the most prestigious medical institutions in the country. Students can stay in the institution’s on-campus hostel. The university has 11 medical faculties. The institution has a large library with over 950 thousand books and periodicals. International collaborations with healthcare institutes and universities exist at the university. Tuition at the University is reasonably priced. Admission to this university does not require an entrance exam.

6. ORENBURG STATE MEDICAL UNIVERSITY, RUSSIA:

Orenburg State Medical University was established in 1944 and is one of Russia’s oldest, most prestigious, and most well-known medical schools. It is located in the Russian city of Orenburg and is consistently ranked as one of the world’s best medical schools. It provides an MBBS program to medical students from Russia and other countries around the world, and its medical credentials are recognised globally, including in the United States, Canada, and India. It is one of the best MBBS programs in Russia, with a seven-decade history and a careful blend of experience, expertise, and modernity.
